title: 2 Easy Ways to Download Images from Google on iPhone & iPad

steps.title: Find your image using the Google search engine.
steps.content: Find your image using the Google search engine . Safari is the default browser for iOS, but you can download other browsers from the App Store . [1] X Research source Enter keywords into Google's search bar, and then tap search to view the results. Tap Images at the top of the search results to show all images that match your keywords.

steps.title: Tap your image.
steps.content: Tap your image. This will open a larger view of the image.

steps.title: Tap and hold the image.
steps.content: Tap and hold the image. A menu will appear after a few seconds.

steps.title: Tap Save to Photos.
steps.content: Tap Save to Photos . This will add the image to your camera roll. This option may appear as Save Image on older devices. To view your image, open the Photos app (the multicolored flower icon on the home screen), then select the Recents album. The camera roll is also where you can find photos taken with your iPhone.

steps.title: Open the Google app.
steps.content: Open the Google app. This looks like a multi-colored G with a white background. If needed, you can download the Google app from the App Store.

steps.title: Find your image.
steps.content: Find your image. Enter keywords into the search bar, then tap search to view the results. Be sure to tap Images to see all image results.

steps.title: Tap your image.
steps.content: Tap your image. This will open the image in a new page. You can also save the image on the results page, but this may result in a lower quality photo.

steps.title: Tap and hold the image.
steps.content: Tap and hold the image. A menu will appear after a few seconds.

steps.title: Tap Add to Photos.
steps.content: Tap Add to Photos . Google may ask for permissions to save to your camera roll. Tap OK . In some cases, you may have to click Visit to go to the host website before you can save. Tap and hold the image, then tap Add to Photos . This option may appear as Save Image on older devices. If you don't have the option to save the image, try using a mobile browser like Chrome or Safari instead.
